intro: Rubus beckeri, commonly known as Becker’s blackberry, is a species of brambles native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black when ripe. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Botanically, it belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is closely related to other bramble species.
